alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 4:54PM MST until August 21 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gisela and Tonto Creek in Gila County in central Arizona... * Until 1045 PM MST. * At 453 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain north of Gisela and south of Payson. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gisela and Tonto Creek. This includes the following highways... State Route 188 near mile marker 271. State Route 87 southbound between mile markers 245 and 247. State Route 87 between mile markers 244 and 247. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
